tweets.content:
pendle meets plasma: when yield farming gets serious

the story that broke defi twitter

imagine launching a new product. watching $400 million flow in during your first week. that is exactly what happened when pendle landed on plasma october 2nd.

@pendle_fi  takes any asset that earns money and splits it into two parts. one part gives you steady fixed returns. the other lets you bet on whether yields will go up or down.

@Plasma  is peter thiel backed blockchain built specifically for stablecoins. their vision targets unbanked billions in emerging markets. 10%+ baseline yields that actually matter for wealth building.

when you combine pendle clever splitting with plasma stablecoin focus you get something special. this integration pushed pendle total tvl past $8.5 billion across all chains. 

plasma became a key accelerator.

numbers that make whales pay attention

the growth happened faster than anyone expected.

- $318 million captured in first 96 hours  
- five pools launched with more coming weekly
- effective yields up to 55% with peaks hitting 64% in optimal setups
- strong trading volume shows real users not just hype

this speed beats most launches on ethereum and solana. people are not just depositing money and leaving. they are actively trading. 

actively farming. actively building wealth.

how the magic actually works

think of it like splitting a rental property. you can sell the house for fixed price today. or keep collecting rent payments. pendle does this with crypto assets.

deposit your stablecoins and choose your path.

- safe route: lock in 25-30% fixed returns per year
- risky route: bet on yields going higher for up to 55% potential with peaks to 64%
- smart route: do both and hedge your bets
- expert route: short yields if you think they will drop

as @DeFi_Dad  puts it "leveraged looping farms for you to earn triple digit yield." perfect for plasma stablecoin edge.

the triple reward system nobody talks about

here is where things get interesting. plasma gives out $900k worth of tokens weekly to pendle users. but you also earn from two other sources simultaneously.

the reward stack breakdown works like this.

- base yield from stablecoin protocols gives 8-30% yearly
- plasma points offer variable upside for future airdrops  
- xpl tokens add 20-30% boost through weekly distributions
- protocol bonuses from underlying platforms provide 5-15% extra

this creates income streams most people miss. you earn from multiple sources. without doing extra work.

real people making real money

community screenshots flooding twitter. users earning over $1000 in their first week. as pendle tweeted about their launch success user @St1t3h   posted exactly this from simple deposits into high yield pools.

as one trader posted "easiest money i have made this year just deposit and watch the numbers go up." the simplicity is what hooks people.

other community wins keep rolling in.

- $500 weekly income from $15k deposits
- some users replacing full time salaries  
- strategies scaling from $5k to $500k positions  
- gas fees so low they barely register

the $1000 monthly math

want to make $1000 per month. here is the realistic breakdown using $20k.

path one works with direct USDe deposits. split into fixed 26% yearly part. then borrow against it at 20% yearly. 

total return around 46% yearly gives you roughly $770 monthly.

path two starts with regular stablecoins. convert to earning USDe version. then split for 26% fixed yearly while keeping variable upside exposure. 

total return hits up to 55% yearly with incentives. $800 to $950 monthly.

yields vary with market conditions and pool saturation. note that liquidity provider positions may face impermanent loss risks. always research thoroughly before depositing.

why this matters now

most yield farming burns out when incentives end. this setup feels different. because the underlying demand is real. pendle proved it on arbitrum with billions in tvl. 

now supercharging plasma stablecoin dominance.

plasma focuses on stablecoins where people actually store wealth. while empowering emerging markets with accessible high yields. 

pendle gives them tools to optimize returns. without complexity.

positioning advantages while early.

- incentive rewards still generous before dilution
- pool sizes small enough for meaningful impact
- strategies proven but not yet crowded
- risk levels suitable for conservative and aggressive players

the data suggests pendle will own significant market share on plasma. smart money is positioning before the obvious becomes expensive.

ready to start earning? bridge stables to plasma then farm on pendle at app.pendle.financ.e. remember yields fluctuate and smart contract risks exist. 

so always do your own research first.

what is your first pendle strategy going to be?

Besides glazing over ABG BD girls, nothing gives crypto degens more pleasure than getting burned on ETH longs every single time the market starts looking good.

But what if there's a way to capture this endless cycle of pain, and turn it into consistent yield?

Introducing YU-ETHUSDT by Boros - where men no longer need to be homeless just to put dot eth on their X profile.

When you long $ETH funding rates, it's like betting on the greed of man. There isn't a single degen in crypto that will not FOMO into $ETH. After all, GCR oneshotted an entire generation of men worldwide to believe that $ETH will one day hit 10k.

Meanwhile, longing ETH YUs is like being the guy that your ex goes to each time she leaves. Whether it's hourly settlements on Hyperliquid or 8-hour settlements on Binance - you're in control, and you're getting paid.

Boros makes it simple and painless to finally make money with ETH. Naked long ETH is like pulling teeth. But long ETH YUs, sip cocktails by the beach.

tweets.content:
USDai's upward depeg is a fascinating case study into stablecoin mechanics, PT <> YT flows, and basic economic principles that underpin DeFi.

WTF is intern waffling about?
Let me break this SILLINESS down and how YOU could have capitalized.
___________________________________________________

Unlike MOST depegged stablecoins, USDai by @USDai_Official depegged in an UPWARD direction. What this means is that traders are currently willing to pay more than $1 for something that should be valued EXACTLY $1.

Your first instinct is probably "what type of regard is buying $1 for more than $1" and I'd USUALLY be in agreeance.

The difference is that holding USDai gives users Allo Points which are being 'priced in' to the standard $1/USDai value.

"But wait... shouldn't every stablecoin with points also be valued > $1 then?"

___________________________________________________

To answer this question, we need to understand how stablecoins maintain peg in the first place. The most common method is using a Peg Stability Module (PSM) which allows users to arbitrage mispricings while returning the stablecoin to peg:
1. Price < $1 â†’ users buy stablecoin and redeem for $1 of underlying (or something similar)
2. Price > $1 â†’ users mint stablecoin and sell for > $1

We are in Scenario 2. for USDai but there is an issue - USDai caps are fully filled so arbitrageurs CANNOT mint more to return it to peg!

The surge in demand for USDai's Allo Points WITHOUT the ability for new mints disrupts the stablecoin equilibrium.

As a result, USDai SHOULD be expected to be ABOVE peg until caps are raised.
___________________________________________________

The next thing you may have noticed is USDai's Implied Yield running to an absolutely SILLY 51.6% fixed APY, by far one of the highest yielding stables on the platform.

There is something CRITICAL to note here - Pendle prices assets in terms of the UNDERLYING token.

In our case, it is USDai which is currently trading at $1.06.
A 51.6% fixed APY is based on this $1.06 face value.

What does this mean for you?
> Buying PT-USDai will let you capture a fixed yield if you are ALREADY holding USDai.
> If you are swapping in from USDC, there is a chance you'll end up with a loss in the event USDai repegs from $1.06 â†’ $1

DEFINITELY exercise caution if you plan on entering PTs now.
___________________________________________________

One thing that is VERY interesting indeed is that if you were an early YT-USDai buyer, you are up heavily on both implied yield AND USDai/USD.

This should make sense since:
1. IY has spiked heavily from ~20% â†’ 51.6%
2. USDai has depegged upwards from $1 â†’ $1.06

While a large component of this IY spike can be attributed to demand for Allo Points, the rest is due to something a widdle bit more structural.

Recall that the thing that affects IY is trading activity of YT and PT:
1. IY â« if people buy YT OR sell PT
2. IY â¬ if people sell YT OR buy PT

In our case, we have PLENTY of people buying YTs.
We do NOT have many people buying PTs since PTs are depegged upwards.

This means we're ultimately left with IYs that we can expect to continue an upward trajectory AT LEAST until USDai's underlying caps are raised!

___________________________________________________

This is a neat little lesson into how caps on stablecoins can:
1. Cause price to depeg in an upward direction
2. Cause IY to spike in an upward direction
3. Both without standard market dynamics to bring them back to normal

If you are able to identify similar set-ups on Pendle's underlying stablecoins, it could VERY MUCH be possible to captures these opportunities.

Intern for one will be keeping a VERY close eye on said protocols and see where dem money bags be lying.

tweets.content:
The Simplest Way to Maximize stcUSD Yield With @pendle_fi  (up to 65% APY)

PTs stand for Principal Tokens, but it's easier to understand them as "Predictable Tokens" because you can essentially predict the return you will get. 

Because PT yield is independent of market conditions, it provides a steady, fixed return that is redeemable in full at maturity. 

With this in mind, here are the simplest ways you can utilize PTs in your yield strategy:

Strategy 1: Hold PT-stcUSD
- 1) Go to app.pendle.finance/trade/marâ€¦
- 2) Connect your wallet
- 3) Swap for output (At current rates, the APY is 15%)
- Risks to consider: PTs are meant to be held until maturity. If, for whatever reason, you decide to sell early, you may incur a loss. In addition, by holding PT tokens, you assume all smart contract risk associated with stcUSD dependencies and Pendle itself.

Strategy 2: Leverage PT-stcUSD on @0xspiralstake 
- 1) Acquire USDC or PT-stcUSD (see Strategy 1)
- 2) Go to app.spiralstake.xyz/productsâ€¦
- 3) Decide how much you want to loop (leverage)
- 4) Click "Leverage" and execute the transaction (At current rates, Net APY is 15%)
- Risks to Consider: Same as Strategy 1, with the extra caveat that the more you loop, the higher chance you have of being liquidated. Giving yourself a buffer is the best way to mitigate this. In addition, if borrowing rates become higher than the yield, your return can flip negative.

I plan to write more posts like this in the future, but please note that everything written here is purely educational and not intended as financial advice. Thank you for reading, and lmk if you have any questions!

tweets.content:
Funding rate is one of the most powerful passive income streams in crypto

But only one protocol truly captures its full potential â†’ @ethena_labs

On perpetual exchanges, traders pay a funding fee to keep the futures price close to the spot price

When the funding rate is positive, longs pay shorts, and the short side receives that funding as income

Ethena takes advantage of this by opening delta-neutral short positions (ETH, BTC, and other altcoins) on CEXs like Binance and Bybit.

Since long positions usually dominate, Ethena consistently earns funding yield and passes it to $sUSDe holders

â¥ Did you know? From 2016 to 2025, around 71.4% of the time, the market had a positive funding rate

The market is almost always net-long, and Ethena built the best engine to monetize it

Ethena even offers this model as Stablecoin-as-a-Service (SaaS) â†’ $USDm on MegaETH letting other chains tap into the same backend

----------------------

The Second Layer: Pendle & PT assets

DeFi takes it even further with a second layer of yield powered by @pendle_fi

sUSDe can be turned into PT assets, offering additional fixed yield for sUSDe holders

â¥ These PT assets also become the new standard in DeFi by 2025.

Today, PTs are accepted as collateral in money markets like @aave, marking a major shift in how DeFi manages risk and yield

More than $8.24B worth of Ethena assets while $5.3B Ethena PT have been deposited into Aave

A New Yield Flywheel â†“

tweets.content:
The premise is simple.

Buy $1 for $0.93.
Wait till maturity.
Redeem.
Profit $0.07.

This is the basis of how Fixed Yield works on @pendle_fi.

Buy a discounted asset. Redeem for full value at maturity. The price appreciation constitutes your "Fixed Yield".

In traditional finance, this role is normally fulfilled by stuff like T-Bills, bonds, term deposits... often ranging in 3%-5% in yield.

On Pendle, Fixed APY for stablecoins can go as high as 17%-18%. For context, even high risk, CCC-junk bonds only offer ~12%.

Now ask yourself this, which one would you trust more?

A permissionless fixed yield contract governed by code, or the "trust me brah" of a dilapidated strip mall on the verge of financial ruin?

As romantic and dreamy as it sounds, stuff like HarryPotterObamaSonic10Inu won't be ones to lure in big peepees like Blackrock and Fidelity. They need stability. They need familiarity. They need to feel comfortable parking billions and trillions, knowing it won't go tits up in the next minute.

Fixed Yield, ladies and gents, is our best chance of onboarding these mfs into DeFi. And Pendle is the gateway. 

But but who the hell and what the f*ck is Pendle and why should we trust you?

To that I say we're the largest crypto yield trading platform in the world, having settled over $58 billion worth of Fixed Yield.

Pendle works.

Over $13B have decided to trust Pendle. Have you?

Fun way to think about PT-USD is a protected put:
- Long asset -> win if up, lose if down
- PT-USD -> win if down AND up (within reason), lose if up bigly

At this stage of the cycle, it's important to consider:
1. How hard has something ran?
2. How much further can it run?
3. What is the potential downside?

If you're using BTC as a target asset, you can compare PT RoIs against BTC price targets at different time frames.
You can then plot these target prices back on the BTC/USD charts.
Its very possible the sucker can maintain momentum and blast through your targets.

But if it doesn't... will you be ready?

the historical apr sits at 48% for vependle holders. read that again.

48% apr just for voting on pools. while people chase 20% aprs that evaporate when farming rewards end, vependle generates cashflow from the actual business pendle runs.

â one user posted $11.8k in monthly vependle rewards

these are people who positioned in the revenue stream of the protocol that centralizes all yield trading in defi.

pendle just ranked #3 in holder revenue across all of crypto in the last 24 hours. ahead of protocols with higher market caps.

ahead of blockchains people think are more valuable. the revenue flows to vependle voters, not speculators hoping for token pumps.

if pendle were a blockchain: it would rank in the top tier for tvl & fees generated. but it is not competing with blockchains.

it is infrastructure that sits on top of everything, capturing yield from staked eth, liquid staking tokens, real world assets, stablecoins.

yield is the backbone of defi. everything revolves around it.

pendle positioned itself at the center & built the rails that all yield flows through:

> when institutions want fixed rates â€“ they use pendle
> when degens want to leverage yield â€“ they use pendle  
> when protocols want to bootstrap liquidity â€“ they incentivize through pendle

the thesis is playing out exactly as early holders predicted. users win more than the team because vependle captures the majority of value creation.

this is not tokenomics designed to benefit insiders. this is revenue sharing with the people who provide governance & liquidity.

people keep asking "is it too late to buy pendle?" wrong question.

the right question is whether you want to own a piece of infrastructure that generates cashflow from every yield trade in crypto... or keep chasing tokens that hope someone else will buy them for more later.

pendle is undervalued at current prices when you compare revenue multiples to traditional markets or even other defi protocols. but the real edge is not hoping the token appreciates.

it is becoming a stakeholder in the fees generated by the largest yield trading platform in the world.

every staking derivative that launches, every rwa token that comes online, every new yield strategy that gets built â€“ they all flow through pendle eventually. vependle holders collect fees on all of it.

& soon, pendle dats could change everything. decentralized autonomous treasuries that bid on pendle tokens & lock them in vependle.

imagine institutional capital competing to own pieces of this revenue stream.

the market is starting to notice:

> trading volume is consistent
> fees are growing

but most people are still thinking about pendle as just another defi token. instead of infrastructure that captures value from the entire yield market.

bold prediction: the biggest risk is not buying pendle & missing the transition from speculation to cashflow generation. yield trading is not going anywhere.

it is the foundation everything else gets built on.

now they collect fees every month while everyone else chases the next narrative.

the only thing you should worry about is not having a position before the market figures out what vependle holders already know.
